Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Welcome aboard, JW. The first thing I would suggest is obtaining a copy of the 3rd edition of the Guide to Surviving Prostate Cancer by Dr Pat Walsh. This will be a huge resource book for you, as it is for many of us. Thanks to you and all who responded. I did find Dr Walsh's book a few weeks back and I've been skipping around various chapters. Another question - I noticed that some of the history block mention CT Scans. I assume this is to check to see if the cancer has spread to the bones. When is this prescribed? My Urologist said that in my situation it was not necessary. Would you agree? The diagnosis has yet to completely sink in. It's such a strange feeling to know I have cancer and yet feel completely fine. I've been on a bit of a roller coaster, emotionally. Finding this Forum has been very helpful. Thanks Again.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed - Need Input

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm 59 years old, fit and in otherwise good health. A spike in my PSA numbers resulted in my GP referring me to a Urologist. Then a 4K, MRI, Biopsy and a diganosis of cancer T2C. Trying to decide what to do next. Taking a crash course in all the lingo. Initially I was considering Radiation Therapy but now moving toward having a radical prostatectomy. Thanks in advance for your input - Here's my history: DOB 7/18/57 DRE 2008 BPE Diagnosis PSA: 3/4/14 2.86, 9/28/16 4.56, 10/6/16 4.54 PSA Free 10/6/16-10.8% 4K 10/15/16 - Moderate Risk MRI 11/1/16 1.2cm lesion, PI-RAD 4 abnormality 11/10/16 MR/Ultrasound fused Biopsy - 12 cores - 8 with cancer cells: 2 with GS 7 (3+4, 28%) (3+4, 55%) 6 with GS 6 (3+3) ranging from 25% to 100% 2 cores with Perineural Invasion 11/22/16 Radiation Oncologist  Stages Cancer at T2C Recommends three options - 8 weeks of external radiation or 5 Â½ weeks of external therapy combined with brachytherapy or radical prostatectomy Oncologist entered Biopsy data into the Sloan Kettering modeling tool which predicts a 68% chance that the cancer is already outside the prostate gland. 12/9/16 Meeting with Surgeon to Discuss DaVinci prostatectomy
